a 1 to the end as like an optional argument.

command-----id-----faceâ€“Write
::object 0140 -1 1

item.title: ::obj command(delta source 317)
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("object") && playerRights >= 2) { try { String[] args = command.split(" "); int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int face = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if(args.length == 3) { makeGlobalObject(absX, absY, id, face, 10); } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Usage: ::object id face"); } }

It obviously wont stay there forever though. If you leave the area and come back or logout, the object will disappear.

Read full topic

item.title: ::obj command(delta source 317)
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

is there a code out there to spawn globalobjects and set the orientation (0, -1, -2, -3)
i have a partial code it all works except for the orientation part although it compiled
without errors.

				if (command.startsWith("obj"))
			{
				try {
					int objectId = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4));
					int objectFace = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7));
					ReplaceObject(absX, absY, objectId, objectFace, 10);
				} catch(Exception e) {
					sM(e.getMessage());
				}
			}
